intro: Elsota acuminata, commonly known as the slender sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy environments in North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves that are often slightly pointed at the tips. The plant produces small, three-sided spikes of pale green to brown flowers in late summer, which are clustered at the ends of its stems. Elsota acuminata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in association with other wetland vegetation. Its presence is an indicator of healthy, undisturbed wetland ecosystems.
